com.mellanox.jxio

Class ClientSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mellanox.jxio.ClientSession

  • public class ClientSession
extends java.lang.Object
    ClientSession is the object that connects to the Server. This is the active side that initiates connection. The application uses it to send requests to the server and receive responses. ClientSession receives several events on his lifetime. On each of them a method of interface Callbacks is invoked. User must implement this interface and pass it in c-tor. The events are: 1. onSessionEstablished. 2. onSessionEvent. 3. onReply 4. onMsgError.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ClientSession.Callbacks
      This interface needs to be implemented and passed to ClientSession in c-tor

             java.net.URI uri,
             ClientSession.Callbacks callbacks)
        Constructor of ClientSession.
        Parameters:
        eventQHandler - - EventQueueHAndler on which the events (onReply, onSessionEstablished etc) of this client will arrive
        uri - - URI of the server to which this Client will connect of the server
        callbacks - - implementation of Interface ClientSession.Callbacks

    • Method Detail

      • sendRequest

        public boolean sendRequest(Msg msg)
        This method sends the request to server.

        The send is asynchronous, therefore even if the function returns, this does not mean that the msg reached the server or even was sent to the server. The size send to Server is the current position of the OUT ByteBuffer

        Parameters:
        msg - - Msg to be sent to Server
        Returns:
        true if queuing of the msg was successful and false otherwise

      • close

        public boolean close()
        This method closes the ClientSession.

        The method is asynchronous: the ClientSession will be closed only when it receives event SESSION_CLOSED

        Returns:
        true if there was a successful call to close of the Client object on C side and false otherwise

        public boolean getIsClosing()
